posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:

Just don't fall into the trap of "Epic-Dodging/ Devastating-Critical/ SCV" thing, otherwise, you will have a perfect-on-paper character that won't hit (AB<36) anything, ever.

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content:
Hey Zelda I notice you want Red Dragon Disciple on a Dex build. I'm not sure what you need, but I can think of 2 options:

1. Str primary + Dex skills, or basically a sneaky str damage dealer with lots of bard buffs

2. Dex primary and use the +8 Str from RDD as just bonus damage. I assume you want SD at 10 because you like epic dodge.

posts.author: zelda_
posts.content: I don't need epic dodge or devastating critical. I just wanna try something different. I like the option "Str primary + Dex skills" I need something like this, nothing so complicated ^^ I know you're both very good with builds, I'm playing a lot of characters using those you've created so I trust you. I've played 20bard/10 rdd/ 10Sd based on strenght, I wanna try this one now but on dex but I don't know how to build it correctly.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Ah, in this case then, ignore the second line, you're gonna be fine.
And like Sky said, you are qualified for ED, so I see no reason not to take it as well.
As long as you don't mess with Dev. Crit in this build (not enough feats for one) and SCV (use Imp. Invisibility instead) then this character has some serious potential.

posts.author: zelda_
posts.content: Perfect so how do you reccomend me to proceed?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Let it run its natural course,
Start with (non min-max version): Str 14(22) Dex 18(32) Con 12(14) Int 14(16) Wis 10 Cha 8(10)
Then go for an Bard(8)/ Rdd(8)/ SD(4) Pre-epic split to maximize your AB and time the 10th SD level at 27th which is a General Epic Feat level, then take Epic Dodge there.
For Pre-epic Feats: WF: Rapier, IC: Rapier, BF, KD, IKD, Dodge, Mobility
For Epic Feats: EWF: Rapier, Epic Prowess, Armour Skin, Epic Dodge, Great DEX IV
Don't forget to take Epic Prowess at your 14th Rdd level, they have it as a bonus epic feat in their list.
All-in-all a HiPS, ED, with sufficient strength character with lot's of skills & some combat tricks up his sleeve.

EDIT: Forgot to mention:
Race: Elf
Final AB: 40
Final AC w/Shield: 38! plus ED & HiPS
Human without KD feats should be able to get ITWF as well.

I run this of the top off my head, so (maybe) I have done a mistake somewhere, but the layout should be clear enough.

Need some caffeine damn it...

Pre-epic Feats: WF: Rapier. Weapon Finesse, Blind-Fight, Dodge, Mobility, Lingering-Song, Curse-Song, Knockdown OR Still-Spell

Here you get decent attack, full bard song and spells, hide in plain sight,and some good strength to back up damage. I would go rapier+shield and simply key your shield on your toolbar to unequip it before casting. Only issue I have with this one is you have to choose what gets left until the end, here I chose to leave epic dodge off until last so I could get one final tumble / hide / move silently dump.

That said I also have a Bard 20 SD 10 CoT 10 that I built for you which is a dual wielding roguish fighter. Same concept but way more feats to play with and you get Lasting Inspiration from level 20 Bard. Where are you planning to play this character? If you want me to post it I will but it's not the class split you originally said.

*Edit: I shot for Bard level 4 spells for Imp Invis ASAP, then shot for bard 16 for max song soon after. It is perfectly fine to change up the leveling order but keep in mind the rule of 4s.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:
Just don't fall into the trap of "Epic-Dodging/ Devastating-Critical/ SCV" thing, otherwise, you will have a perfect-on-paper character that won't hit (AB<36) anything, ever.
Funny that you should bring that up Valerfor 
I have of course tried different approaches to the ED/ SCV/ Dev crit. combo with these 3 classes. They are all Rapier wielding elves and none were worth posting here.
A Bard 8/ RDD 10/ SD 22 with "only" ED and SCV ended with Str 22, Dex 32 and AB 40
A Bard 11/ RDD 10/ SD 19 with ED and Dev crit ended with Str 28, Dex 25 and AB 38
A Bard 8/ RDD 10/ SD 22 with ED, SCV and Dev crit ended with Str 26, Dex 30 and AB 36. It was so feat starved that there was not even room for Weapon finesse and Epic prowess.
I don't know if anybody can do it better, but it was indeed disappointing.
